intro: Hieracium vogesiacum subsp. asturicum, commonly known as the Asturian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. It is relatively small in stature, with slender stems and inconspicuous foliage. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
